that's going to be a problem for any client windows or ubuntu. is there no way for you to get on the same subnet?
are you using a virtual machine?
then both your virtual client and your host ARE on the same subnet.
trust me, your host and virtual guest are on a shared subnet.
if your guest and host did not have a shared subnet, then the guest would be unable to access the internet.
you can still transfer files between your guest and host. if you need them to be on the same subnet, you'll need to configure virtualbox for bridged networking.
